title: Mobile App Development
summary: Create applications for mobile devices using native (iOS/Android) or cross-platform frameworks (React Native/Flutter).

steps.title: JavaScript & ES6+ (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Master modern JavaScript including ES6+ features, async programming with Promises and async/await, and essential programming concepts for mobile development.

quiz.question: What is JavaScript?
options: High-level programming language for web and mobile
quiz.explanation: JavaScript is essential for adding interactivity to applications.

quiz.question: What is ES6?
quiz.explanation: ES6 introduced arrow functions, classes, let/const, and more.

quiz.question: What is an arrow function?
quiz.explanation: Arrow functions provide shorter syntax and lexical 'this' binding.

quiz.question: What is a Promise?
options: Object representing eventual completion or failure
quiz.explanation: Promises handle asynchronous operations with .then() and .catch().

quiz.question: What is async/await?
options: Syntactic sugar for working with Promises
quiz.explanation: async/await makes asynchronous code look synchronous.

quiz.question: What is destructuring?
options: Extracting values from arrays or objects
quiz.explanation: Destructuring: const {name, age} = person; extracts properties.

quiz.question: What is the spread operator?
quiz.explanation: Spread operator copies arrays/objects: [...arr], {...obj}.

quiz.question: What is template literal?
quiz.explanation: Template literals use backticks for multi-line strings and interpolation.

quiz.question: What is const?
quiz.explanation: const declares block-scoped constants, can't be reassigned.

quiz.question: What is the difference between let and var?
options: let is block-scoped, var is function-scoped
quiz.explanation: let prevents issues with hoisting and scope leakage.

quiz.question: What is array map()?
quiz.explanation: map() creates new array by applying function: arr.map(x => x * 2).

quiz.question: What is array filter()?
options: Creates new array with elements passing test
quiz.explanation: filter() returns matching items: arr.filter(x => x > 5).

quiz.question: What is array reduce()?
quiz.explanation: reduce() accumulates values: arr.reduce((sum, x) => sum + x, 0).

quiz.question: What is a callback function?
options: Function passed as argument to another function
quiz.explanation: Callbacks execute after async operations complete.

quiz.question: What is JSON?
options: JavaScript Object Notation for data exchange
quiz.explanation: JSON.stringify() and JSON.parse() convert between objects and strings.

quiz.question: What is closure?
options: Function accessing variables from outer scope
quiz.explanation: Closures preserve access to outer function variables.

quiz.question: What is 'this' keyword?
quiz.explanation: 'this' behavior varies between regular and arrow functions.

quiz.question: What is default parameter?
quiz.explanation: function greet(name = 'User') uses default if no argument.

quiz.question: What is rest parameter?
quiz.explanation: function sum(...nums) accepts any number of arguments.

quiz.question: What is try-catch?
quiz.explanation: try-catch handles exceptions without crashing app.

steps.title: React.js Fundamentals (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Learn React fundamentals including components, state management, hooks (useState, useEffect, useContext), and React best practices.

quiz.question: What is React?
options: JavaScript library for building user interfaces
quiz.explanation: React creates reusable UI components for web and mobile apps.

quiz.question: What is a component?
quiz.explanation: Components are JavaScript functions/classes that return JSX.

quiz.question: What is JSX?
options: JavaScript syntax extension for HTML-like code
quiz.explanation: JSX allows writing HTML-like code in JavaScript files.

quiz.question: What is useState?
quiz.explanation: useState: const [count, setCount] = useState(0) manages state.

quiz.question: What is useEffect?
options: Hook for side effects like data fetching
quiz.explanation: useEffect runs after render for API calls, subscriptions, etc.

quiz.question: What is useContext?
quiz.explanation: useContext accesses shared data without prop drilling.

quiz.question: What is props?
quiz.explanation: Props pass data from parent to child components.

quiz.question: What is state?
quiz.explanation: State is local data that triggers re-renders when changed.

quiz.question: What is virtual DOM?
options: Lightweight copy of actual DOM for efficient updates
quiz.explanation: Virtual DOM minimizes expensive real DOM manipulations.

quiz.question: What is component lifecycle?
options: Phases of component: mount, update, unmount
quiz.explanation: Lifecycle methods/hooks manage component behavior over time.

quiz.question: What is conditional rendering?
options: Rendering different UI based on conditions
quiz.explanation: Use && or ternary: {isLoggedIn ? <Dashboard /> : <Login />}.

quiz.question: What is list rendering?
quiz.explanation: items.map(item => <Item key={item.id} data={item} />).

quiz.question: What is key prop?
quiz.explanation: Keys help React identify which items changed for efficient updates.

quiz.question: What is event handling?
options: Responding to user interactions like clicks
quiz.explanation: <button onClick={handleClick}>Click</button> handles events.

quiz.question: What is controlled component?
options: Form input whose value is controlled by React state
quiz.explanation: <input value={name} onChange={e => setName(e.target.value)} />.

quiz.question: What is useRef?
options: Hook for accessing DOM elements or persisting values
quiz.explanation: useRef creates mutable reference that doesn't cause re-renders.

quiz.question: What is React Fragment?
options: Wrapper to group elements without extra DOM node
quiz.explanation: <React.Fragment> or <> groups children without div wrapper.

quiz.question: What is prop drilling?
options: Passing props through multiple component levels
quiz.explanation: Context API or state management avoids prop drilling.

quiz.question: What is memo()?
quiz.explanation: React.memo() memoizes component, re-renders only when props change.

quiz.question: What is useMemo?
quiz.explanation: useMemo caches computed values between renders.

steps.title: React Native Basics (6-8 weeks)
steps.description: Master React Native fundamentals including core components, Flexbox layout, React Navigation, and building mobile apps with Expo.

quiz.question: What is React Native?
options: Framework for building native mobile apps with React
quiz.explanation: React Native compiles to native iOS and Android code.

quiz.question: What is Expo?
quiz.explanation: Expo provides managed workflow with built-in APIs and tools.

quiz.question: What is a View component?
options: Basic container like div in web
quiz.explanation: View is fundamental building block for layouts.

quiz.question: What is Text component?
quiz.explanation: Text renders text content, unlike web where any tag can.

quiz.question: What is StyleSheet?
options: API for creating styles in React Native
quiz.explanation: StyleSheet.create() optimizes style objects.

quiz.question: What is TouchableOpacity?
quiz.explanation: TouchableOpacity provides press feedback by reducing opacity.

quiz.question: What is FlatList?
options: Efficient list component for rendering scrollable lists
quiz.explanation: FlatList virtualizes items for performance with large datasets.

quiz.question: What is navigation in React Native?
options: Moving between screens using React Navigation
quiz.explanation: React Navigation library manages screen transitions.

quiz.question: What is AsyncStorage?
options: Local storage for persisting data on device
quiz.explanation: AsyncStorage stores key-value pairs asynchronously.

quiz.question: What is metro bundler?
quiz.explanation: Metro compiles JavaScript code for mobile apps.

quiz.question: What is Flexbox in React Native?
quiz.explanation: Flexbox uses flexDirection, justifyContent, alignItems.

quiz.question: What is ScrollView?
quiz.explanation: ScrollView enables vertical/horizontal scrolling.

quiz.question: What is Image component?
options: Displays images from local or remote sources
quiz.explanation: <Image source={{uri: 'url'}} /> or require('./img.png').

quiz.question: What is TextInput?
quiz.explanation: TextInput captures user input with keyboard.

quiz.question: What is SafeAreaView?
options: Renders content within safe boundaries (notches, status bar)
quiz.explanation: SafeAreaView prevents content from overlapping device features.

quiz.question: What is Stack Navigator?
options: Navigation pattern with stack of screens
quiz.explanation: Stack Navigator manages screen history, push/pop transitions.

quiz.question: What is Tab Navigator?
quiz.explanation: Tab Navigator creates tabbed interfaces for app sections.

quiz.question: What is Drawer Navigator?
quiz.explanation: Drawer Navigator provides hamburger menu navigation.

quiz.question: What is Pressable?
options: Flexible touchable component with press feedback
quiz.explanation: Pressable detects press interactions with customizable feedback.

quiz.question: What is hot reloading?
options: Auto-refresh on code changes without losing state
quiz.explanation: Hot reloading speeds development by preserving app state.

steps.title: Advanced React Native (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Learn API integration, state management (Redux, Zustand), authentication flows, push notifications, camera/media access, geolocation, and performance optimization.

quiz.question: What is API integration?
options: Connecting app to backend services via HTTP
quiz.explanation: Apps use fetch() or axios to get/post data from APIs.

quiz.question: What is Redux?
options: State management library for predictable state
quiz.explanation: Redux centralizes app state with actions and reducers.

quiz.question: What is Zustand?
quiz.explanation: Zustand is simpler alternative to Redux with hooks.

quiz.question: What is authentication?
quiz.explanation: Authentication uses tokens (JWT) or OAuth for secure access.

quiz.question: What are push notifications?
options: Messages sent to users even when app is closed
quiz.explanation: Push notifications use Firebase Cloud Messaging or APNs.

quiz.question: What is the Camera API?
options: Access to device camera for photos/Videos
quiz.explanation: expo-camera provides camera access in React Native.

quiz.question: What is geolocation?
options: Accessing device GPS for location data
quiz.explanation: expo-location gets current position, tracks movement.

quiz.question: What is performance optimization?
options: Techniques to improve app speed and responsiveness
quiz.explanation: Use memoization, lazy loading, image optimization, etc.

quiz.question: What is a JWT token?
options: JSON Web Token for secure authentication
quiz.explanation: JWT encodes user info, sent with API requests for auth.

quiz.question: What is React Query?
options: Library for fetching, caching, and updating data
quiz.explanation: React Query simplifies server state management.

quiz.question: What is OAuth?
options: Open Authorization protocol for secure login
quiz.explanation: OAuth enables login with Google, Facebook, etc.

quiz.question: What is deep linking?
options: Opening app to specific screen from URL
quiz.explanation: Deep links navigate users directly to app content.

quiz.question: What is image caching?
options: Storing images locally for faster loading
quiz.explanation: react-native-fast-image provides image caching.

quiz.question: What is lazy loading?
quiz.explanation: Lazy loading improves performance by deferring non-critical resources.

quiz.question: What is offline support?
quiz.explanation: NetInfo detects connectivity; AsyncStorage enables offline data.

quiz.question: What is biometric authentication?
options: Login using fingerprint or face recognition
quiz.explanation: expo-local-authentication provides biometric security.

quiz.question: What is in-app purchase?
quiz.explanation: react-native-iap handles subscriptions and purchases.

quiz.question: What is analytics?
options: Tracking user behavior and app usage
quiz.explanation: Firebase Analytics, Mixpanel track events and metrics.

quiz.question: What is crash reporting?
quiz.explanation: Sentry, Crashlytics capture errors and stack traces.

quiz.question: What is code splitting?
options: Breaking code into smaller bundles loaded on demand
quiz.explanation: Code splitting reduces initial bundle size for faster startup.

steps.title: Flutter & Dart Programming (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Learn Dart programming language and Flutter basics including widgets, layouts, state management, and Material Design.

resources.title: The Complete Dart & Flutter Developer Course

quiz.question: What is Dart?
quiz.explanation: Dart is object-oriented language developed by Google.

quiz.question: What is Flutter?
options: UI framework for building cross-platform apps
quiz.explanation: Flutter compiles to native code for iOS, Android, web, desktop.

quiz.question: What is a widget in Flutter?
options: Everything in Flutter UI is a widget
quiz.explanation: Widgets are immutable building blocks of Flutter UI.

quiz.question: What is StatelessWidget?
options: Widget that doesn't change once built
quiz.explanation: StatelessWidget is immutable, rebuild requires new instance.

quiz.question: What is StatefulWidget?
options: Widget with mutable state that can rebuild
quiz.explanation: StatefulWidget has State object for dynamic UI updates.

quiz.question: What is hot reload?
options: Instantly seeing code changes without restart
quiz.explanation: Hot reload updates UI in seconds preserving app state.

quiz.question: What is Material Design?
quiz.explanation: Material Design provides widgets like Scaffold, AppBar, Card.

quiz.question: What is null safety in Dart?
quiz.explanation: Null safety prevents null reference errors at compile time.

quiz.question: What is async/await in Dart?
quiz.explanation: async/await works with Future objects for async code.

quiz.question: What is a Future in Dart?
options: Object representing value available in future
quiz.explanation: Future handles asynchronous operations like network requests.

quiz.question: What is MaterialApp in Flutter?
options: Root widget providing Material Design theming
quiz.explanation: MaterialApp wraps app with theme, navigation, and localization.

quiz.question: What is Scaffold widget?
options: Provides basic visual structure with AppBar, Drawer, BottomNavigationBar
quiz.explanation: Scaffold implements basic Material Design layout.

quiz.question: What is Column widget for?
quiz.explanation: Column arranges child widgets in a vertical array.

quiz.question: What is Row widget used for?
quiz.explanation: Row arranges child widgets in a horizontal array.

quiz.question: What is setState() in Flutter?
options: Method to rebuild widget when state changes
quiz.explanation: setState() notifies framework to schedule a rebuild.

quiz.question: What is provider package?
quiz.explanation: Provider simplifies dependency injection and state sharing.

quiz.question: What is Navigator in Flutter?
options: Manages stack of routes for screen navigation
quiz.explanation: Navigator.push() and pop() manage route transitions.

quiz.question: What is pubspec.yaml?
options: File defining project dependencies and metadata
quiz.explanation: pubspec.yaml declares packages, assets, and project info.

quiz.question: What is Container widget?
options: Versatile widget for padding, margin, decoration, constraints
quiz.explanation: Container combines painting, positioning, and sizing.

quiz.question: What is the build() method?
options: Method returning widget tree for UI
quiz.explanation: build() is called when widget needs to be rendered.

steps.title: Flutter Advanced (6-8 weeks)
steps.description: Master Flutter widgets, navigation, state management (Provider, Riverpod), HTTP requests, Firebase integration, and testing.

quiz.question: What is Provider in Flutter?
quiz.explanation: Provider simplifies dependency injection and state sharing.

quiz.question: What is Riverpod?
quiz.explanation: Riverpod eliminates context dependency, compile-time safety.

quiz.question: What is navigation in Flutter?
quiz.explanation: Navigator.push() and Navigator.pop() manage routes.

quiz.question: What is the http package?
quiz.explanation: http package sends GET/POST requests to REST APIs.

quiz.question: What is Firebase?
options: Backend platform for authentication, database, storage
quiz.explanation: Firebase provides real-time database, auth, hosting, functions.

quiz.question: What is a Row widget?
quiz.explanation: Row arranges children horizontally in Flutter.

quiz.question: What is a Column widget?
quiz.explanation: Column arranges children vertically in Flutter.

quiz.question: What is a Stack widget?
options: Overlapping widgets on top of each other
quiz.explanation: Stack positions children relative to box edges.

quiz.question: What is widget testing?
quiz.explanation: Widget tests verify UI behavior using testWidgets().

quiz.question: What is BuildContext?
options: Reference to widget's location in tree
quiz.explanation: BuildContext provides access to theme, navigator, inherited widgets.

quiz.question: What are animations in Flutter?
options: Visual transitions using AnimationController and Tween
quiz.explanation: Animations use AnimationController with curves and values.

quiz.question: How do you create custom widgets?
quiz.explanation: Custom widgets compose or extend existing widgets.

quiz.question: What are platform channels?
options: Communication bridge between Flutter and native code
quiz.explanation: Platform channels use MethodChannel for native API access.

quiz.question: What is async programming in Dart?
quiz.explanation: async functions return Futures for asynchronous work.

quiz.question: What are Streams in Dart?
options: Sequence of asynchronous events over time
quiz.explanation: Streams handle multiple asynchronous values using listen().

quiz.question: What is the http package for?
options: Making HTTP GET/POST requests to APIs
quiz.explanation: http package simplifies RESTful API calls.

quiz.question: How do you parse JSON in Dart?
quiz.explanation: dart:convert library handles JSON serialization.

quiz.question: What is form validation?
quiz.explanation: Form validators ensure data correctness before submission.

quiz.question: What is shared_preferences?
options: Package for storing simple key-value data locally
quiz.explanation: shared_preferences persists small amounts of data.

quiz.question: What is responsive design?
options: Adapting UI to different screen sizes and orientations
quiz.explanation: Use MediaQuery and LayoutBuilder for responsive UIs.

steps.title: Native iOS Development (Swift) (3-4 months)
steps.description: Learn Swift programming, SwiftUI, UIKit, networking, Core Data, and iOS app development for Apple devices.

quiz.question: What is Swift?
quiz.explanation: Swift is modern, safe language replacing Objective-C.

quiz.question: What is SwiftUI?
options: Declarative UI framework for Apple platforms
quiz.explanation: SwiftUI builds UI with declarative Swift syntax.

quiz.question: What is UIKit?
quiz.explanation: UIKit is imperative framework using ViewControllers.

quiz.question: What is Xcode?
quiz.explanation: Xcode provides editor, debugger, simulator, and build tools.

quiz.question: What is Core Data?
options: Apple's framework for persistent data storage
quiz.explanation: Core Data manages object graph, saves to SQLite.

quiz.question: What is URLSession?
quiz.explanation: URLSession handles HTTP requests and downloads.

quiz.question: What is @State in SwiftUI?
quiz.explanation: @State creates source of truth for view updates.

quiz.question: What is @Binding in SwiftUI?
quiz.explanation: @Binding creates reference to parent's @State.

quiz.question: What is a View in SwiftUI?
quiz.explanation: View protocol requires body property returning some View.

quiz.question: What is ARC?
options: Automatic Reference Counting for memory management
quiz.explanation: ARC automatically manages memory by counting references.

quiz.question: What are optionals in Swift?
options: Variables that can hold a value or nil
quiz.explanation: Optionals use ? and handle absence of values safely.

quiz.question: What is delegation pattern?
options: Design pattern where object delegates tasks to helper
quiz.explanation: Delegation uses protocols for object communication.

quiz.question: What is Auto Layout?
options: System for creating adaptive UI with constraints
quiz.explanation: Auto Layout defines rules for view positioning and sizing.

quiz.question: What is view lifecycle in UIKit?
quiz.explanation: Lifecycle methods control view loading and appearance.

quiz.question: What is MVC pattern in iOS?
quiz.explanation: MVC organizes code into three interconnected components.

quiz.question: What are protocols in Swift?
quiz.explanation: Protocols define interfaces that types can conform to.

quiz.question: What are closures in Swift?
quiz.explanation: Closures capture and store references to variables.

quiz.question: What is Grand Central Dispatch?
quiz.explanation: GCD manages queues for asynchronous task execution.

quiz.question: What is app lifecycle?
options: States: not running, inactive, active, background, suspended
quiz.explanation: App lifecycle managed by AppDelegate methods.

quiz.question: What is error handling in Swift?
quiz.explanation: Swift uses throws, try, and Error protocol for errors.

steps.title: Native Android Development (Kotlin) (3-4 months)
steps.description: Master Kotlin programming, Jetpack Compose, Android SDK, Room database, and Android app development.

quiz.question: What is Kotlin?
quiz.explanation: Kotlin is official Android language, replacing Java.

quiz.question: What is Jetpack Compose?
quiz.explanation: Compose builds Android UI with Kotlin functions.

quiz.question: What is Android SDK?
options: Software Development Kit for Android apps
quiz.explanation: SDK provides libraries, tools, and APIs for Android.

quiz.question: What is an Activity?
options: Single screen with UI in Android
quiz.explanation: Activity manages UI and lifecycle for a screen.

quiz.question: What is Room database?
quiz.explanation: Room simplifies SQLite with compile-time verification.

quiz.question: What is ViewModel?
options: Stores UI-related data surviving configuration changes
quiz.explanation: ViewModel separates UI logic from lifecycle.

quiz.question: What is LiveData?
quiz.explanation: LiveData updates UI automatically when data changes.

quiz.question: What is Retrofit?
options: HTTP client for REST API calls
quiz.explanation: Retrofit simplifies API integration with annotations.

quiz.question: What is a Fragment?
options: Reusable portion of UI in Activity
quiz.explanation: Fragment represents modular section of UI.

quiz.question: What is Android Studio?
quiz.explanation: Android Studio provides editor, emulator, and build tools.

quiz.question: What is null safety in Kotlin?
options: Types are non-nullable by default, use ? for nullable
quiz.explanation: Kotlin prevents null pointer exceptions at compile time.

quiz.question: What are data classes?
options: Classes automatically generating equals, hashCode, toString
quiz.explanation: Data classes reduce boilerplate for data holding classes.

quiz.question: What are coroutines in Kotlin?
quiz.explanation: Coroutines use suspend functions for async operations.

quiz.question: What are scope functions?
options: Functions executing code block in object context: let, run, with, apply, also
quiz.explanation: Scope functions create temporary scope for object.

quiz.question: What is Material Design in Android?
options: Google's design language with components like CardView, FAB
quiz.explanation: Material Design ensures consistent, modern UI.

quiz.question: What are intents?
quiz.explanation: Intents start activities, services, or broadcast messages.

quiz.question: What is a Service in Android?
options: Component running in background without UI
quiz.explanation: Services handle long-running operations in background.

quiz.question: What are broadcast receivers?
quiz.explanation: Receivers listen for broadcasts like battery low, boot completed.

quiz.question: What is Gradle?
options: Build automation tool for Android projects
quiz.explanation: Gradle manages dependencies, builds, and variants.

steps.title: Deployment & Publishing (3-4 weeks)
steps.description: Learn to build and release apps to App Store and Google Play Store, including code signing, CI/CD with EAS Build, TestFlight, and over-the-air updates.

quiz.question: What is app deployment?
options: Publishing app to App Store/Play Store
quiz.explanation: Deployment makes app available for users to download.

quiz.question: What is code signing?
options: Cryptographically signing app to verify authenticity
quiz.explanation: Code signing proves app hasn't been tampered with.

quiz.question: What is TestFlight?
quiz.explanation: TestFlight distributes iOS apps to beta testers.

quiz.question: What is EAS Build?
quiz.explanation: EAS Build compiles apps without local setup.

quiz.question: What is an APK?
quiz.explanation: APK contains all files needed to install Android app.

quiz.question: What is an AAB?
options: Android App Bundle for optimized delivery
quiz.explanation: AAB is Google Play's publishing format.

quiz.question: What is OTA update?
quiz.explanation: OTA updates JavaScript bundle directly (Expo Updates).

quiz.question: What is app submission?
quiz.explanation: Submission requires metadata, screenshots, compliance.

quiz.question: What is CI/CD for mobile?
quiz.explanation: CI/CD automates testing, building, and releasing.

quiz.question: What is App Store Connect?
quiz.explanation: App Store Connect manages releases, analytics, and TestFlight.

quiz.question: What are provisioning profiles?
options: Files linking certificates, devices, and app IDs for iOS
quiz.explanation: Provisioning profiles authorize app installation on devices.

quiz.question: What are app review guidelines?
options: Rules apps must follow for store approval
quiz.explanation: Guidelines cover content, privacy, functionality, design.

quiz.question: What is version management?
options: Tracking and updating app version numbers
quiz.explanation: Version numbers indicate releases: major.minor.patch.

quiz.question: What are screenshots and metadata?
options: Images and descriptions showcasing app in store
quiz.explanation: Screenshots, description, keywords attract users.

quiz.question: What are release strategies?
options: Phased rollout, canary releases, staged deployment
quiz.explanation: Strategies minimize risk by gradual user exposure.

quiz.question: What is Google Play Console?
options: Google's platform for managing Android apps
quiz.explanation: Play Console handles releases, analytics, ratings, policies.

quiz.question: What are build variants?
options: Different app versions: debug, release, staging
quiz.explanation: Variants configure different environments and features.

quiz.question: What are app signing keys?
quiz.explanation: Signing keys must be kept secure for app updates.

quiz.question: What is beta testing?
options: Testing app with limited users before public release
quiz.explanation: Beta testing identifies bugs using TestFlight or internal tracks.

quiz.question: What is app store optimization?
options: Improving app visibility through keywords, ratings, screenshots
quiz.explanation: ASO increases downloads through better discoverability.

steps.title: Essential Topics (Ongoing)
steps.description: Master UI/UX design principles, backend & APIs, state management patterns, testing strategies, and performance optimization for mobile apps.

quiz.question: What is UI/UX design?
quiz.explanation: UI/UX focuses on user experience and interface design.

quiz.question: What is Material Design?
quiz.explanation: Material Design provides guidelines for Android apps.

quiz.question: What is Human Interface Guidelines?
quiz.explanation: HIG ensures consistency across iOS apps.

quiz.question: What is Firebase?
quiz.explanation: Firebase provides auth, database, storage, analytics, etc.

quiz.question: What is Supabase?
quiz.explanation: Supabase offers PostgreSQL, auth, storage, real-time.

quiz.question: What is Redux Toolkit?
quiz.explanation: Redux Toolkit reduces Redux boilerplate.

quiz.question: What is unit testing?
quiz.explanation: Unit tests verify isolated logic with Jest/Mocha.

quiz.question: What is integration testing?
quiz.explanation: Integration tests verify component interactions.

quiz.question: What is performance optimization?
quiz.explanation: Optimize images, lazy load, minimize re-renders.

quiz.question: What is accessibility?
options: Making apps usable for people with disabilities
quiz.explanation: Accessibility includes screen readers, labels, contrast.

quiz.question: What are debugging tools?
options: Tools like Chrome DevTools, Flipper, React DevTools
quiz.explanation: Debugging tools inspect state, network, and performance.

quiz.question: What is app security?
options: Protecting data with encryption, secure storage, HTTPS
quiz.explanation: Security prevents unauthorized access and data breaches.

quiz.question: What is data encryption?
options: Converting data to unreadable format with algorithms
quiz.explanation: Encryption protects sensitive data at rest and in transit.

quiz.question: What is API versioning?
options: Managing different API versions for backward compatibility
quiz.explanation: Versioning allows gradual API changes without breaking clients.

quiz.question: What are mobile design patterns?
options: Reusable solutions: MVC, MVVM, Repository, Singleton
quiz.explanation: Design patterns solve common architectural problems.

quiz.question: What is app architecture?
options: Structure organizing code: clean architecture, layered architecture
quiz.explanation: Good architecture separates concerns and improves maintainability.

quiz.question: What is memory management?
options: Preventing memory leaks and optimizing resource usage
quiz.explanation: Proper memory management prevents crashes and slowdowns.

quiz.question: What is battery optimization?
options: Reducing battery drain through efficient code and background tasks
quiz.explanation: Optimization limits location updates, network calls, wake locks.

quiz.question: What is localization?
options: Adapting app for different languages and regions
quiz.explanation: Localization includes translations, date/time formats, currencies.

quiz.question: What is analytics integration?
options: Tracking user behavior with Firebase Analytics, Mixpanel
quiz.explanation: Analytics provide insights into user engagement and issues.

projects.title: Personal Todo List App
projects.description: Build a simple mobile todo list application with local storage, add/delete/edit tasks, and a clean UI. Perfect for learning mobile app fundamentals.
tasks: Set up React Native development environment
Design the app UI with FlatList for tasks
Implement add, edit, and delete task functionality
Style the app with custom components
Test on both iOS and Android simulators

projects.title: Weather Forecast App
projects.description: Create a weather application that fetches data from a weather API, displays current weather and forecasts, and supports multiple locations.
tasks: Implement geolocation to detect user's location
Create UI for displaying weather data
Add search functionality for different cities
Handle loading states and error messages

projects.title: Social Media Feed App
projects.description: Develop a social media style app with user authentication, photo uploads, likes, comments, and a scrollable feed using Firebase backend.
tasks: Set up Firebase project and authentication
Implement user registration and login screens
Create image picker and upload functionality

projects.title: E-Commerce Shopping App
projects.description: Build a full-featured e-commerce mobile app with product catalog, cart, checkout, payment integration, and order tracking.
tasks: Create product listing and detail screens
Build checkout flow with address management

projects.title: Real-Time Chat Application
projects.description: Create a sophisticated messaging app with real-time chat, group conversations, media sharing, typing indicators, and end-to-end encryption.
tasks: Set up WebSocket server or use Firebase/Socket.io
Implement typing indicators and read receipts
Optimize for performance and offline functionality
